intro: Sorocea nitida, commonly known as the slender sorocea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Sorocea nitida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
